rukus.text: And recall in the Book, Abraham; he was a man of truth, a prophet
When he said to his father: "O father, why do you serve what does not hear or see, nor help you in anything
My father, knowledge has come to me which did not come to you. So follow me that I will guide you to a level path
My father, do not serve the devil. For the devil was ever disobedient to the Almighty
My father, I fear that a retribution will inflict you from the Almighty and that you will become an ally to the devil
He said: "Have you abandoned my gods O Abraham? If you do not stop this, I will stone you; and let me be
He said: "Peace be upon you, I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. He has been most kind to me
And I will abandon you and what you call on besides God. And I will implore my Lord, hoping that I will not be mischievous in imploring my Lord
So when he abandoned them and what they served besides God, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and each of them We made a prophet
And We granted them from Our mercy, and We made for them a tongue of truthfulness to be heard
